intro: Microtoena nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal microtoena, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a distinct midrib. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the spring and early summer. Microtoena nepalensis is native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India, where it thrives in cool, humid climates.
